newsitem.title: USA: Globalink in pact with Packard Bell NEC.
newsitem.headline: Globalink in pact with Packard Bell NEC.

text.p: Globalink Inc said Tuesday it reached an agreement with Packard Bell NEC to bundle its translation software with personal computers sold in Brazil.
Globalink, which provides foreign language translation software and services, said it was also in talks with Packard Bell NEC to extend the agreement to the rest of Latin America.
Globalink said the potential value of the agreement, including the possible expansion to other Lation American countries, is about $1.0 million in the first year.

Packard Bell NEC is a U.S.-based computer maker in which NEC Corp of Japan holds a stake recently raised to 51.9 percent, from 43.94 percent. The Japanese company, which has announced an additional $285 million investment in the firm, holds a 19.84 percent voting rights in the computer maker.
